instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3023A wont load osx
threads.message:
Have a 820-3023A that wont load osx with built in drive or known good usb drive. After about a minute loading with apple logo it will just turn itself off. Put fresh thermal paste on cpu but made no difference

Have no idea where to start for issue like this.

threads.title: 820-3023A wont load osx
threads.message: Try new BIOS, with clean ME region.

threads.title: 820-3023A wont load osx
threads.message:
Upload your backup.
In the meantime, you can try these files...

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Ks4enZKnwLVCh6LbIzKI2prlst-Y6qNV[/url]

No idea if any good.
I do not remember where I got them from...

threads.title: 820-3023A wont load osx
threads.message: I have TL86A programmer but do not have a adapter for this type of bios chip. What do i need to get in order to reprogram this type of bios?

threads.title: 820-3023A wont load osx
threads.message: Some of my posts show few pictures with a "fast" adapter for WSON-8 chips...
